overview: In the Pastan series, Meldibekov employs his own body to investigate the image of the Central-Asian "Orientalistic Other."  In Pastan I, the character performed by the artist passively allows himself to be beaten and humiliated.  Viewers are confronted with a seemingly limitless sense of submission, but simultaneously with the monumental force of naked life [sic].  Meldibekov: "This work symbolizes what people in Central-Asia are put through by systems that use violence and fear to maintain control."  [Overiview Courtesy of Stedelijk Museum]
title: PASTAN I
